import vispy.app
from vispy.testing import requires_application
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import assert_raises
from vispy.testing import assert_equal
from vispy.testing import assert_not_equal
@requires_application('pyside')
def test_use():
    vispy.app.use_app()
    default_app = vispy.app._default_app.default_app
    vispy.app._default_app.default_app = None
    app_name = default_app.backend_name.split(' ')[0]
    try:
        assert_raises(TypeError, vispy.use)
        assert_equal(vispy.app._default_app.default_app, None)
        vispy.use(gl='gl2')
        assert_equal(vispy.app._default_app.default_app, None)
        vispy.use(app_name)
        assert_not_equal(vispy.app._default_app.default_app, None)
        wrong_name = 'glfw' if app_name.lower() != 'glfw' else 'pyqt4'
        assert_raises(RuntimeError, vispy.use, wrong_name)
        vispy.use(app_name, 'gl2')
    finally:
        vispy.app._default_app.default_app = default_app

test_use()

import unittest
import numpy as np
import pytest
from vispy.gloo import Texture1D
from vispy.gloo import Texture2D
from vispy.gloo import Texture3D
from vispy.gloo import TextureAtlas
from vispy.testing import requires_pyopengl
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import assert_raises
@requires_pyopengl()
def test_texture_1D():
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    assert T._shape == (10, 1)
    assert 'Texture1D' in repr(T)
    assert T.glsl_type == ('uniform', 'sampler1D')
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    assert T.width == 10
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    T.resize((5,))
    assert T.shape == (5, 1)
    glir_cmd = T._glir.clear()[-1]
    assert glir_cmd[0] == 'SIZE'
    assert glir_cmd[2] == (5, 1)
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    assert_raises(ValueError, T.resize, (5, 5, 5, 5))
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data, resizable=False)
    assert_raises(RuntimeError, T.resize, (5,))
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    T.set_data(np.ones((20,), np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (20, 1)
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    T.set_data(np.ones((5,), np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (5, 1)
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    assert_raises(ValueError, T.set_data, np.ones((5,)), offset=(8,))
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    assert_raises(ValueError, T.set_data, np.ones((10, 10)))
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    T.set_data(np.ones((10,), np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (10, 1)
    glir_cmd = T._glir.clear()[-1]
    assert glir_cmd[0] == 'DATA'
    shape1 = 10,
    shape3 = 10, 3
    data = np.zeros((10, 1), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    assert T.shape == (10, 1)
    assert T._format == 'luminance'
    T.set_data(np.zeros(shape3, np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (10, 3)
    assert T._format == 'rgb'
    T.set_data(np.zeros(shape1, np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (10, 1)
    assert T._format == 'luminance'
    T.resize(shape3)
    assert T.shape == (10, 3)
    assert T._format == 'rgb'
    T.resize(shape1)
    assert T.shape == (10, 1)
    assert T._format == 'luminance'
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture1D(data=data)
    data = np.zeros((10,), dtype=np.float32)
    T.set_data(data)
    data = np.zeros((12,), dtype=np.int32)
    T.set_data(data)

test_texture_1D()

import unittest
import numpy as np
import pytest
from vispy.gloo import Texture1D
from vispy.gloo import Texture2D
from vispy.gloo import Texture3D
from vispy.gloo import TextureAtlas
from vispy.testing import requires_pyopengl
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import assert_raises
@requires_pyopengl()
def test_texture_3D():
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    assert T._shape == (10, 10, 10, 1)
    assert 'Texture3D' in repr(T)
    assert T.glsl_type == ('uniform', 'sampler3D')
    data = np.zeros((10, 20, 30), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    assert T.width == 30
    assert T.height == 20
    assert T.depth == 10
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    T.resize((5, 5, 5))
    assert T.shape == (5, 5, 5, 1)
    glir_cmd = T._glir.clear()[-1]
    assert glir_cmd[0] == 'SIZE'
    assert glir_cmd[2] == (5, 5, 5, 1)
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    assert_raises(ValueError, T.resize, (5, 5, 5, 5))
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data, resizable=False)
    assert_raises(RuntimeError, T.resize, (5, 5, 5))
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    T.set_data(np.ones((20, 20, 20), np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (20, 20, 20, 1)
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    T.set_data(np.ones((5, 5, 5), np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (5, 5, 5, 1)
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    assert_raises(ValueError, T.set_data, np.ones((5, 5, 5)), offset=(8, 8, 8))
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    assert_raises(ValueError, T.set_data, np.ones((10,)))
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    T.set_data(np.ones((10, 10, 10), np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (10, 10, 10, 1)
    glir_cmd = T._glir.clear()[-1]
    assert glir_cmd[0] == 'DATA'
    shape1 = 10, 10, 10
    shape3 = 10, 10, 10, 3
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10, 1), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    assert T.shape == (10, 10, 10, 1)
    assert T._format == 'luminance'
    T.set_data(np.zeros(shape3, np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (10, 10, 10, 3)
    assert T._format == 'rgb'
    T.set_data(np.zeros(shape1, np.uint8))
    assert T.shape == (10, 10, 10, 1)
    assert T._format == 'luminance'
    T.resize(shape3)
    assert T.shape == (10, 10, 10, 3)
    assert T._format == 'rgb'
    T.resize(shape1)
    assert T.shape == (10, 10, 10, 1)
    assert T._format == 'luminance'
    data = np.zeros((10, 10, 10), dtype=np.uint8)
    T = Texture3D(data=data)
    data = np.zeros((10, 11, 11), dtype=np.float32)
    T.set_data(data)
    data = np.zeros((12, 12, 10), dtype=np.int32)
    T.set_data(data)

test_texture_3D()

import numpy as np
from vispy import scene
from vispy.color import Color
from vispy.geometry import create_cube
from vispy.geometry import create_sphere
from vispy.testing import TestingCanvas
from vispy.testing import requires_application
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import requires_pyopengl
from vispy.visuals.filters import ShadingFilter
from vispy.visuals.filters import WireframeFilter
from vispy.visuals.filters.mesh import _as_rgba
import pytest
from vispy.visuals.transforms import STTransform
@requires_pyopengl()
def test_mesh_color():
    vertices, filled_indices, outline_indices = create_cube()
    axis = scene.visuals.Mesh(vertices['position'], outline_indices, color=
        'black', mode='lines')
    axis.color = 0.1, 0.3, 0.7, 0.9
    new_vertices = axis.mesh_data.get_vertices()
    np.testing.assert_allclose(axis.color.rgba, (0.1, 0.3, 0.7, 0.9))
    np.testing.assert_allclose(vertices['position'], new_vertices)

test_mesh_color()

import numpy as np
from vispy import scene
from vispy.color import Color
from vispy.geometry import create_cube
from vispy.geometry import create_sphere
from vispy.testing import TestingCanvas
from vispy.testing import requires_application
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import requires_pyopengl
from vispy.visuals.filters import ShadingFilter
from vispy.visuals.filters import WireframeFilter
from vispy.visuals.filters.mesh import _as_rgba
import pytest
from vispy.visuals.transforms import STTransform
@requires_pyopengl()
def test_mesh_bounds():
    vertices, filled_indices, outline_indices = create_cube()
    axis = scene.visuals.Mesh(vertices['position'], outline_indices, color=
        'black', mode='lines')
    for i in range(3):
        np.testing.assert_allclose(axis.bounds(i), (-1.0, 1.0))
    axis = scene.visuals.Mesh(vertices['position'][:, :2], outline_indices,
        color='black', mode='lines')
    for i in range(2):
        np.testing.assert_allclose(axis.bounds(i), (-1.0, 1.0))
    np.testing.assert_allclose(axis.bounds(2), (0.0, 0.0))

test_mesh_bounds()

import pytest
import numpy as np
from vispy import scene
from vispy.testing import TestingCanvas
from vispy.testing import requires_application
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import requires_pyopengl
from vispy.testing import raises
from vispy.testing.image_tester import assert_image_approved
from vispy.testing.image_tester import downsample
from vispy.testing.rendered_array_tester import compare_render
from vispy.testing.rendered_array_tester import max_for_dtype
@requires_pyopengl()
def test_volume():
    vol = np.zeros((20, 20, 20), 'float32')
    vol[8:16, 8:16, :] = 1.0
    V = scene.visuals.Volume(vol)
    assert V.clim == (0, 1)
    assert V.method == 'mip'
    assert V.interpolation == 'linear'
    with raises(ValueError):
        V.set_data(np.zeros((20, 20), 'float32'))
    V.set_data(vol, (0.5, 0.8))
    assert V.clim == (0.5, 0.8)
    with raises(ValueError):
        V.set_data((0.5, 0.8, 1.0))
    V.method = 'iso'
    assert V.method == 'iso'
    V.interpolation = 'nearest'
    assert V.interpolation == 'nearest'
    V.relative_step_size = 1.1
    assert V.relative_step_size == 1.1
    with raises(ValueError):
        V.relative_step_size = 0

test_volume()

import pytest
import numpy as np
from vispy import scene
from vispy.testing import TestingCanvas
from vispy.testing import requires_application
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import requires_pyopengl
from vispy.testing import raises
from vispy.testing.image_tester import assert_image_approved
from vispy.testing.image_tester import downsample
from vispy.testing.rendered_array_tester import compare_render
from vispy.testing.rendered_array_tester import max_for_dtype
@requires_pyopengl()
def test_set_data_does_not_change_input():
    V = scene.visuals.Volume(np.zeros((20, 20, 20), dtype=np.float32))
    vol = np.random.randint(0, 200, (20, 20, 20))
    for dtype in ['uint8', 'int16', 'uint16', 'float32', 'float64']:
        vol_copy = np.array(vol, dtype=dtype, copy=True)
        V.set_data(vol_copy, clim=(0, 200))
        assert np.allclose(vol, vol_copy)
    vol2 = np.array(vol, dtype=np.float32, copy=True)
    assert np.allclose(vol, vol2)
    V.set_data(vol2, clim=(0, 200), copy=False)
    assert np.allclose(vol, vol2)

test_set_data_does_not_change_input()

import numpy as np
def test_queue():
    q = glir.GlirQueue()
    parser = glir.GlirParser()
    N = 5
    for i in range(N):
        q.command('FOO', 'BAR', i)
    cmds = q.clear()
    for i in range(N):
        assert cmds[i] == ('FOO', 'BAR', i)
    cmds1 = [('DATA', 1), ('SIZE', 1), ('FOO', 1), ('SIZE', 1), ('FOO', 1),
        ('DATA', 1), ('DATA', 1)]
    cmds2 = [c[0] for c in q._shared._filter(cmds1, parser)]
    assert cmds2 == ['FOO', 'SIZE', 'FOO', 'DATA', 'DATA']
    cmds1 = [('DATA', 1), ('SIZE', 1), ('FOO', 1), ('SIZE', 2), ('SIZE', 2),
        ('DATA', 2), ('SIZE', 1), ('FOO', 1), ('DATA', 1), ('DATA', 1)]
    cmds2 = q._shared._filter(cmds1, parser)
    assert cmds2 == [('FOO', 1), ('SIZE', 2), ('DATA', 2), ('SIZE', 1), (
        'FOO', 1), ('DATA', 1), ('DATA', 1)]
    shader1 = (
        """
        precision highp float;uniform mediump vec4 u_foo;uniform vec4 u_bar;
        """
        .strip().replace(';', ';\n'))
    shader2 = convert_shader('desktop', shader1)
    assert 'highp' not in shader2
    assert 'mediump' not in shader2
    assert 'precision' not in shader2
    shader3 = convert_shader('es2', shader2)
    assert 'precision highp float;' in shader3
    assert shader3.startswith('precision')
    shader4 = (
        """
        #version 100; precision highp float;uniform mediump vec4 u_foo;uniform vec4 u_bar;
        """
        .strip().replace(';', ';\n'))
    shader5 = convert_shader('es2', shader4)
    assert 'precision highp float;' in shader5
    assert shader3.startswith('precision')

import unittest
import numpy as np
from vispy import gloo
from vispy import app
from vispy.gloo.program import Program
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.testing import requires_application
from vispy.gloo.context import set_current_canvas
from vispy.gloo.context import forget_canvas
from vispy.gloo.program import VertexShader
from vispy.gloo.program import FragmentShader
from vispy.gloo import VertexBuffer
class DummyParser(gloo.glir.BaseGlirParser):

    @property
    def shader_compatibility(self):
        return 'desktop'

    def parse(self, commands):
        pass
class DummyCanvas:
    def __init__(self):
        self.context = gloo.context.GLContext()
        self.context.shared.parser = DummyParser()
        self.context.glir.flush = lambda *args: None
class ProgramTest(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_draw(self):
        program = Program('attribute float A;', 'uniform float foo')
        program['A'] = np.zeros((10,), np.float32)
        dummy_canvas = DummyCanvas()
        glir = dummy_canvas.context.glir
        set_current_canvas(dummy_canvas)
        try:
            program.draw('triangles')
            glir_cmd = glir.clear()[-1]
            assert glir_cmd[0] == 'DRAW'
            assert len(glir_cmd[-2]) == 2
            indices = gloo.IndexBuffer(np.zeros(10, dtype=np.uint8))
            program.draw('triangles', indices)
            glir_cmd = glir.clear()[-1]
            assert glir_cmd[0] == 'DRAW'
            assert len(glir_cmd[-2]) == 3
            self.assertRaises(ValueError, program.draw, 'nogeometricshape')
            self.assertRaises(TypeError, program.draw, 'triangles', 'notindex')
            program = Program('attribute float A;', 'uniform float foo')
            self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, program.draw, 'triangles')
            program = Program('attribute float A; attribute float B;', 'foo')
            program['A'] = np.zeros((10,), np.float32)
            program['B'] = np.zeros((11,), np.float32)
            self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, program.draw, 'triangles')
        finally:
            forget_canvas(dummy_canvas)
ProgramTest().test_draw()

from copy import deepcopy
import weakref

# A list to hold weak references to canvas objects
canvas_references = []

def forget_canvas(canvas):
    # Create a weak reference to the canvas to be removed
    weak_canvas_ref = weakref.ref(canvas)
    
    # Iterate over the list of canvas references and remove the specified canvas
    canvas_references[:] = [ref for ref in canvas_references if ref() is not None and ref() is not weak_canvas_ref()]

from vispy import app

def list_fonts():
    # Retrieve system fonts using the private function
    system_fonts = app._list_fonts()
    
    # Predefined list of vispy fonts
    _vispy_fonts = ['Arial', 'Helvetica', 'Times New Roman', 'Courier New', 'Verdana']
    
    # Combine system fonts with vispy fonts and remove duplicates
    all_fonts = list(set(system_fonts) | set(_vispy_fonts))
    
    # Return a sorted list of fonts (case-insensitive)
    return sorted(all_fonts, key=lambda x: x.lower())

import ctypes
import ctypes.wintypes

def get_dpi(raise_error=True):
    # Get the handle to the primary screen
    hdc = ctypes.windll.user32.GetDC(0)
    
    # Get the horizontal and vertical resolution
    horizontal_res = ctypes.windll.gdi32.GetDeviceCaps(hdc, 88)  # LOGPIXELSX
    vertical_res = ctypes.windll.gdi32.GetDeviceCaps(hdc, 90)    # LOGPIXELSY
    
    # Get the size of the screen in inches
    screen_width = ctypes.windll.user32.GetSystemMetrics(0)  # SM_CXSCREEN
    screen_height = ctypes.windll.user32.GetSystemMetrics(1) # SM_CYSCREEN
    
    # Calculate the size in inches
    width_in_inches = screen_width / horizontal_res
    height_in_inches = screen_height / vertical_res
    
    # Calculate DPI
    dpi = (horizontal_res + vertical_res) / 2.0
    
    # Release the device context
    ctypes.windll.user32.ReleaseDC(0, hdc)
    
    return dpi

import numpy as np


def stft(x, n_fft=1024, step=512, fs=2 * np.pi, window='hann'):
    # Ensure x is a numpy array
    x = np.asarray(x)
    
    # Zero-pad the signal if its length is less than n_fft
    if len(x) < n_fft:
        x = np.pad(x, (0, n_fft - len(x)), mode='constant')
    
    # Determine the step size
    if step is None:
        step = n_fft // 2
    
    # Number of steps
    n_steps = (len(x) - n_fft) // step + 1
    
    # Prepare the output array
    stft = np.zeros((n_fft // 2 + 1, n_steps), dtype=np.complex_)
    
    # Create the window function
    if window == 'hann':
        win = np.hanning(n_fft)
    else:
        win = np.ones(n_fft)
    
    # Compute the STFT
    for i in range(n_steps):
        start = i * step
        segment = x[start:start + n_fft] * win
        stft[:, i] = np.fft.rfft(segment)
    
    return stft

def test_stft():

    assert_raises(ValueError, stft, [[]])
    result = stft([])
    assert np.allclose(result, np.zeros_like(result))
    n_fft = 256
    step = 128
    for n_samples, n_estimates in ((256, 1), (383, 1), (384, 2), (511, 2),
        (512, 3)):
        result = stft(np.ones(n_samples), n_fft=n_fft, step=step, window=None)
        assert result.shape[1] == n_estimates
        expected = np.zeros(n_fft // 2 + 1)
        expected[0] = 1
        for res in result.T:
            assert np.allclose(expected, np.abs(res))
            assert np.allclose(expected, np.abs(res))
    for n_pts, last_freq in zip((256, 255), (500.0, 498.0)):
        freqs = fft_freqs(n_pts, 1000)
        assert freqs[0] == 0
        assert np.allclose(freqs[-1], last_freq, atol=0.1)

def test_color_interpretation():
    """Test basic color interpretation API"""
    r = ColorArray('r')
    print(r)
    r2 = ColorArray(r)
    assert_equal(r, r2)
    r2.rgb = 0, 0, 0
    assert_equal(r2, ColorArray('black'))
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('r'))
    assert_equal(r, r.copy())
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('#ff0000'))
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('#FF0000FF'))
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('red'))
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('red', alpha=1.0))
    assert_equal(ColorArray((1, 0, 0, 0.1)), ColorArray('red', alpha=0.1))
    assert_array_equal(r.rgb.ravel(), (1.0, 0.0, 0.0))
    assert_array_equal(r.rgba.ravel(), (1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0))
    assert_array_equal(r.RGBA.ravel(), (255, 0, 0, 255))
    rgb = ColorArray(list('rgb'))
    print(rgb)
    assert_array_equal(rgb, ColorArray(np.eye(3)))
    rgb = ColorArray(['r', (0, 1, 0), '#0000ffff'])
    assert_array_equal(rgb, ColorArray(np.eye(3)))
    assert_raises(RuntimeError, ColorArray, ['r', np.eye(3)])
    r = ColorArray('#ffff')
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('white'))
    r = ColorArray('#ff000000')
    assert_true('turquoise' in get_color_names())
    assert_equal(r.alpha, 0)
    r.alpha = 1.0
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('r'))
    r.alpha = 0
    r.rgb = 1, 0, 0
    assert_equal(r.alpha, 0)
    assert_equal(r.hex, ['#ff0000'])
    r.alpha = 1
    r.hex = '00ff00'
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('g'))
    assert_array_equal(r.rgb.ravel(), (0.0, 1.0, 0.0))
    r.RGB = 255, 0, 0
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('r'))
    assert_array_equal(r.RGB.ravel(), (255, 0, 0))
    r.RGBA = 255, 0, 0, 0
    assert_equal(r, ColorArray('r', alpha=0))
    w = ColorArray()
    w.rgb = ColorArray('r').rgb + ColorArray('g').rgb + ColorArray('b').rgb
    assert_equal(w, ColorArray('white'))
    w = ColorArray('white')
    assert_equal(w, w.darker().lighter())
    assert_equal(w, w.darker(0.1).darker(-0.1))
    w2 = w.darker()
    assert_true(w != w2)
    w.darker(copy=False)
    assert_equal(w, w2)
    with use_log_level('warning', record=True, print_msg=False) as w:
        w = ColorArray('white')
        w.value = 2
        assert_equal(len(w), 1)
    assert_equal(w, ColorArray('white'))
    assert_raises(ValueError, ColorArray, '#ffii00')
    assert_raises(ValueError, ColorArray, '#ff000')
    assert_raises(ValueError, ColorArray, [0, 0])
    assert_raises(ValueError, ColorArray, [2, 0, 0])
    assert_raises(ValueError, ColorArray, [-1, 0, 0])
    c = ColorArray([2.0, 0.0, 0.0], clip=True)
    assert_true(np.all(c.rgb <= 1))
    c = ColorArray([-1.0, 0.0, 0.0], clip=True)
    assert_true(np.all(c.rgb >= 0))
    for key in get_color_names():

    assert_raises(ValueError, ColorArray, 'foo')
    _color_dict = get_color_dict()
    assert isinstance(_color_dict, dict)
    assert set(_color_dict.keys()) == set(get_color_names())

from __future__ import division
import warnings
import numpy as np
from hsluv import hsluv_to_rgb
import vispy.gloo
from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable


def _mix_simple(a, b, x):
    """Mix b (with proportion x) with a."""
    x = np.clip(x, 0.0, 1.0)
    return (1.0 - x) * a + x * b


def _find_controls(x, controls=None, clip=None):
    x_controls = np.clip(np.searchsorted(controls, x) - 1, 0, clip)
    return x_controls.astype(np.int32)


def _interpolate_multi(colors, x, controls):
    x = x.ravel()
    n = len(colors)
    x_step = _find_controls(x, controls, n - 2)
    controls_length = np.diff(controls).astype(np.float32)
    controls_length[controls_length == 0.0] = 1.0
    _to_clip = x - controls[x_step]
    _to_clip /= controls_length[x_step]
    x_rel = np.clip(_to_clip, 0.0, 1.0)
    return colors[x_step], colors[x_step + 1], x_rel[:, None]


def mix(colors, x, controls=None):
    """Blend colors based on the mixing factor x and optional control points."""
    colors = np.asarray(colors)
    if controls is not None:
        controls = np.asarray(controls)
    
    if np.isscalar(x):
        x = np.array([x])
    
    if controls is not None:
        color_a, color_b, x_rel = _interpolate_multi(colors, x, controls)
    else:
        color_a = colors[np.floor(x * (len(colors) - 1)).astype(int)]
        color_b = colors[np.ceil(x * (len(colors) - 1)).astype(int)]
        x_rel = x * (len(colors) - 1) - np.floor(x * (len(colors) - 1))
    
    return _mix_simple(color_a, color_b, x_rel)

def test_colormap_interpolation():
    """Test interpolation routines for colormaps."""
    import vispy.color.colormap as c
    assert_raises(AssertionError, c._glsl_step, [0.0, 1.0])
    for fun in (c._glsl_step, c._glsl_mix):
        assert_raises(AssertionError, fun, controls=[0.1, 1.0])
        assert_raises(AssertionError, fun, controls=[0.0, 0.9])
        assert_raises(AssertionError, fun, controls=[0.1, 0.9])
    color_0 = np.array([1.0, 0.0, 0.0])
    color_1 = np.array([0.0, 1.0, 0.0])
    color_2 = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 1.0])
    colors_00 = np.vstack((color_0, color_0))
    colors_01 = np.vstack((color_0, color_1))
    colors_11 = np.vstack((color_1, color_1))
    colors_021 = np.vstack((color_0, color_2, color_1))
    controls_2 = np.array([0.0, 1.0])
    controls_3 = np.array([0.0, 0.25, 1.0])
    x = np.array([-1.0, 0.0, 0.1, 0.4, 0.5, 0.6, 1.0, 2.0])[:, None]
    mixed_2 = mix(colors_01, x, controls_2)
    mixed_3 = mix(colors_021, x, controls_3)
    for y in (mixed_2, mixed_3):
        assert_allclose(y[:2, :], colors_00)
        assert_allclose(y[-2:, :], colors_11)
    assert_allclose(mixed_2[:, -1], np.zeros(len(y)))

from __future__ import division
import warnings
import numpy as np
from hsluv import hsluv_to_rgb
import vispy.gloo
from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def get_colormap(name):
    # Check if the input is already a Colormap object
    if isinstance(name, ScalarMappable):
        return name

    # Predefined list of colormaps
    predefined_colormaps = {
        'viridis': plt.cm.viridis,
        'plasma': plt.cm.plasma,
        'inferno': plt.cm.inferno,
        'magma': plt.cm.magma,
        'cividis': plt.cm.cividis,
        'gray': plt.cm.gray,
        'jet': plt.cm.jet,
    }

    # Attempt to retrieve the colormap from the predefined list
    if name in predefined_colormaps:
        return predefined_colormaps[name]

    # If the colormap is not found in the predefined list, try to get it from Matplotlib
    try:
        return plt.get_cmap(name)
    except ValueError:
        warnings.warn(f"Colormap '{name}' not found. Returning default colormap 'viridis'.")
        return plt.cm.viridis

from __future__ import division
import warnings
import numpy as np
from hsluv import hsluv_to_rgb
import vispy.gloo
from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable


def _normalize(x, cmin=None, cmax=None, clip=True):
    x = np.asarray(x)  # Convert input to a numpy array if it's not already
    if cmin is None:
        cmin = np.min(x)  # Use the minimum value of x if cmin is not provided
    if cmax is None:
        cmax = np.max(x)  # Use the maximum value of x if cmax is not provided

    if cmin == cmax:
        return np.full_like(x, 0.5)  # Return an array of 0.5 if min and max are the same

    normalized = (x - cmin) / (cmax - cmin)  # Normalize the array to [0, 1]

    if clip:
        normalized = np.clip(normalized, 0, 1)  # Clip the values to the range [0, 1]

    return normalized

from __future__ import division
import numpy as np

def create_sphere(rows=10, cols=10, depth=10, radius=1.0, offset=True,
    subdivisions=3, method='latitude'):
    
    if method == 'latitude':
        phi = np.linspace(0, np.pi, rows)  # latitude
        theta = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, cols)  # longitude
        if offset:
            theta += np.pi / cols / 2  # offset for alternating rows
        theta = np.tile(theta, (rows, 1))
        phi = np.tile(phi[:, np.newaxis], (1, cols))
        
        x = radius * np.sin(phi) * np.cos(theta)
        y = radius * np.sin(phi) * np.sin(theta)
        z = radius * np.cos(phi)
        
        vertices = np.column_stack((x.flatten(), y.flatten(), z.flatten()))
        faces = []
        for i in range(rows - 1):
            for j in range(cols):
                next_j = (j + 1) % cols
                faces.append([i * cols + j, (i + 1) * cols + j, (i + 1) * cols + next_j])
                faces.append([i * cols + j, (i + 1) * cols + next_j, i * cols + next_j])
        
    elif method == 'ico':
        # Create an icosahedron and subdivide
        phi = (1 + np.sqrt(5)) / 2  # golden ratio
        vertices = np.array([
            [-1,  phi, 0],
            [ 1,  phi, 0],
            [-1, -phi, 0],
            [ 1, -phi, 0],
            [0, -1,  phi],
            [0,  1,  phi],
            [0, -1, -phi],
            [0,  1, -phi],
            [ phi, 0, -1],
            [ phi, 0,  1],
            [-phi, 0, -1],
            [-phi, 0,  1],
        ])
        faces = np.array([
            [0, 11, 5],
            [0, 5, 1],
            [0, 1, 7],
            [0, 7, 10],
            [0, 10, 11],
            [1, 5, 9],
            [5, 11, 4],
            [11, 10, 2],
            [10, 7, 6],
            [7, 1, 8],
            [3, 9, 4],
            [3, 4, 2],
            [3, 2, 6],
            [3, 6, 8],
            [3, 8, 9],
            [4, 9, 5],
            [2, 4, 11],
            [6, 2, 10],
            [8, 6, 7],
            [9, 8, 1],
        ])
        
        for _ in range(subdivisions):
            new_faces = []
            for face in faces:
                v1, v2, v3 = vertices[face]
                a = (v1 + v2) / 2
                b = (v2 + v3) / 2
                c = (v3 + v1) / 2
                vertices = np.vstack([vertices, a, b, c])
                a_idx, b_idx, c_idx = len(vertices) - 3, len(vertices) - 2, len(vertices) - 1
                new_faces.extend([
                    [face[0], a_idx, c_idx],
                    [face[1], b_idx, a_idx],
                    [face[2], c_idx, b_idx],
                    [a_idx, b_idx, c_idx],
                ])
            faces = np.array(new_faces)
        
        vertices = vertices / np.linalg.norm(vertices, axis=1)[:, np.newaxis] * radius
        
    elif method == 'cube':
        # Create a cube and project to sphere
        vertices = []
        faces = []
        for x in [-1, 1]:
            for y in [-1, 1]:
                for z in [-1, 1]:
                    vertices.append([x, y, z])
        
        vertices = np.array(vertices) * radius
        faces = [
            [0, 1, 2, 3],
            [4, 5, 6, 7],
            [0, 1, 5, 4],
            [2, 3, 7, 6],
            [0, 2, 6, 4],
            [1, 3, 7, 5],
        ]
        
        # Subdivide faces
        for _ in range(depth):
            new_faces = []
            for face in faces:
                v1, v2, v3, v4 = [vertices[i] for i in face]
                a = (v1 + v2) / 2
                b = (v2 + v3) / 2
                c = (v3 + v4) / 2
                d = (v4 + v1) / 2
                e = (v1 + v3) / 2
                f = (v2 + v4) / 2
                vertices = np.vstack([vertices, a, b, c, d, e, f])
                a_idx, b_idx, c_idx, d_idx, e_idx, f_idx = len(vertices) - 6, len(vertices) - 5, len(vertices) - 4, len(vertices) - 3, len(vertices) - 2, len(vertices) - 1
                new_faces.extend([
                    [face[0], a_idx, e_idx, d_idx],
                    [a_idx, face[1], b_idx, e_idx],
                    [e_idx, b_idx, face[2], c_idx],
                    [d_idx, e_idx, c_idx, face[3]],
                    [e_idx, b_idx, f_idx, d_idx],
                    [f_idx, b_idx, face[1], face[0]],
                ])
            faces = np.array(new_faces)
        
    else:
        raise ValueError("Invalid method. Choose from 'latitude', 'ico', or 'cube'.")
    
    return vertices, faces

from __future__ import division
import numpy as np


def create_cylinder(rows, cols, radius=[1.0, 1.0], length=1.0, offset=False):
    # Create arrays to hold the vertices and faces
    vertices = []
    faces = []

    # Calculate the angle step for columns
    angle_step = 2 * np.pi / cols
    # Calculate the height step for rows
    height_step = length / (rows - 1) if rows > 1 else 0

    for i in range(rows):
        # Calculate the height of the current row
        z = i * height_step
        # Calculate the radius for the current row
        current_radius = radius[0] + (radius[1] - radius[0]) * (i / (rows - 1)) if rows > 1 else radius[0]

        for j in range(cols):
            # Calculate the angle for the current column
            angle = j * angle_step
            # Calculate the x and y coordinates
            x = current_radius * np.cos(angle)
            y = current_radius * np.sin(angle)
            # Apply offset if needed
            if offset and i % 2 == 1:
                x += current_radius * np.cos(angle_step / 2)
                y += current_radius * np.sin(angle_step / 2)
            # Append the vertex
            vertices.append((x, y, z))

    # Create faces by connecting the vertices
    for i in range(rows - 1):
        for j in range(cols):
            # Get the current and next column index (with wrap-around)
            next_j = (j + 1) % cols
            # Create two triangles for each quad
            faces.append((i * cols + j, (i + 1) * cols + j, (i + 1) * cols + next_j))
            faces.append((i * cols + j, (i + 1) * cols + next_j, i * cols + next_j))

    # Convert vertices and faces to numpy arrays
    vertices = np.array(vertices)
    faces = np.array(faces)

    # Create a MeshData object to hold the mesh information
    cylinder = {'vertices': vertices, 'faces': faces}
    
    return cylinder

from vispy.geometry import resize
def test_resize():
    """Test image resizing algorithms"""
    assert_raises(ValueError, resize, np.zeros(3), (3, 3))
    assert_raises(ValueError, resize, np.zeros((3, 3)), (3,))
    assert_raises(ValueError, resize, np.zeros((3, 3)), (4, 4), kind='foo')
    for kind, tol in (('nearest', 1e-05), ('linear', 0.2)):
        shape = np.array((10, 11, 3))
        data = np.random.RandomState(0).rand(*shape)
        assert_allclose(data, resize(data, shape[:2], kind=kind), rtol=
            1e-05, atol=1e-05)
        assert_allclose(data, resize(resize(data, 2 * shape[:2], kind=kind),
            shape[:2], kind=kind), atol=tol, rtol=tol)

test_resize()

from __future__ import division
import re


def find_program_variables(code):
    vars = {}
    
    # Regular expressions to match variable declarations
    uniform_pattern = r'uniform\s+(\w+)\s+(\w+);'
    attribute_pattern = r'attribute\s+(\w+)\s+(\w+);'
    varying_pattern = r'varying\s+(\w+)\s+(\w+);'
    
    # Find uniform variables
    for match in re.finditer(uniform_pattern, code):
        var_type, var_name = match.groups()
        vars[var_name] = ('uniform', var_type)
    
    # Find attribute variables
    for match in re.finditer(attribute_pattern, code):
        var_type, var_name = match.groups()
        vars[var_name] = ('attribute', var_type)
    
    # Find varying variables
    for match in re.finditer(varying_pattern, code):
        var_type, var_name = match.groups()
        vars[var_name] = ('varying', var_type)
    
    return vars

import warnings
import numpy as np
from vispy.gloo.texture import Texture2D
from vispy.gloo.texture import Texture3D
from vispy.gloo.texture import convert_dtype_and_clip
from vispy.util import np_copy_if_needed


def get_default_clim_from_data(data):
    # Filter out non-finite values (NaNs, positive and negative infinity)
    finite_data = data[np.isfinite(data)]
    
    # Check if there are any finite values
    if finite_data.size == 0:
        warnings.warn("No finite values found in the data.")
        return np.nan, np.nan  # Return NaN for both min and max if no finite values exist
    
    # Calculate the minimum and maximum from the finite values
    min_value = np.min(finite_data)
    max_value = np.max(finite_data)
    
    return min_value, max_value

    assert clim == (5, 25)
    data = np.array([np.nan, np.nan, np.nan]).astype(np.float32)
    clim = get_default_clim_from_dtype(data.dtype)
    assert clim == (0, 1)
    clim = get_default_clim_from_data(data)
    assert clim == (0, 0)
    data = np.array([np.nan, np.inf, -np.inf]).astype(np.float32)
    clim = get_default_clim_from_dtype(data.dtype)
    assert clim == (0, 1)
    clim = get_default_clim_from_data(data)
    assert clim == (0, 0)

test_default_clim_non_finite()

from os import path as op

from vispy.io import load_crate
from vispy.io import imsave

from vispy.io import read_png
from vispy.io import write_png
from vispy.testing import requires_img_lib
from vispy.testing import run_tests_if_main
from vispy.util import _TempDir
temp_dir = _TempDir()
@requires_img_lib()
def test_read_write_image():
    """Test reading and writing of images"""
    fname = op.join(temp_dir, 'out.png')
    im1 = load_crate()
    imsave(fname, im1, format='png')
    with warnings.catch_warnings(record=True):
        im2 = imread(fname)
    assert_allclose(im1, im2)
test_read_write_image()
